entry.summary:
Author: meowzar56

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,085Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 24

Summary: “I trained you to live.” Those words echoed in his head like a ghost. Dick had to go to Spyral—forced—before he’d even begun to understand what had happened to him. Yet when he gets back he notices their hypnos commands never really left his head.Now, with Bruce ignoring him entirely and the silent judgment—or outright hatred—of his entire family pressing down, Dick felt the last threads of restraint fray. He was teetering on the edge of losing it entirely.

entry.title: Unobtainable (Second Chances)
entry.summary:
Author: TuneinAnytime (FreeFalling)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,445Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 57

Summary: Everyone has a soulmate, has a name that appears on their wrist sometime after they become an adult. But not everyone gets the privilege of actually being with their soulmate. Dick is one of those people. Because Dick's soulmate is unobtainable, dead before Dick received his name and pushed aside by Dick before that. And Dick has not forgiven himself since. Has not let himself forget everything he did wrong for the boy he was supposed to cherish, as both a brother and a soulmate. But then, everything changes when Dick is called into Gotham for a case. Suddenly, he's confronted with his own emotions: his loneliness in Bludhaven, his grief for his soulmate, his feelings for Gotham's newest crime lord… Wait, what was that last one?

entry.title: Livin' On A Prayer
entry.summary:
Author: arakhnoidsilk

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,538Chapters: 15/15Kudos: 70

Summary: "Jason Todd and Richard Grayson are, as they said previously, vigilantes. Like Spider-Man, they keep the city safe and, from what we have gathered in the last two months, only one of them has access to magic or has enhanced abilities, which is Jason Todd. Again, as mentioned by Grayson before, Todd was the one who came into contact with our already known symbiote Venom, a high-risk subject if not handled properly."Spider-Man added some details on the handling of the symbiote, which read, and I quote: 'Unnaturally quick to bond with the host, responsive but strangely docile compared to my experience with the alien. Seems like the symbiote and the host have a proper balance in their presence, and it looks like Red Hood doesn't break a sweat in controlling when the alien is presenting outside his body.' End quote."Some eyes in the room widened in surprise while Jason felt a snort escaping him.'Doesn't break a sweat,' my ass.

entry.title: My Personal Purgatory
entry.summary:
Author: vampgalmexa

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,588Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 9

Summary: After barely surviving a targeted attack while living under his civilian identity, Jason Todd is forced into the Gotham Safe Haven Center, a refuge designed to contain the broken pieces left behind by the city’s violence. His admission couldn’t have been more ill-timed. He was moments away from revealing himself to Bruce Wayne and delivering the reckoning he believes Bruce never sought after his death.Now, confined within sterile halls, tangled in mandatory evaluations and a system that insists on labeling him as a victim, Jason waits—restless, wounded, and burning with unfinished purpose—for the center’s legal department to authorize his release.But Gotham has a way of shifting destinies, and something within those walls may be forcing Jason to question the vengeance he once thought was absolute.

entry.title: Transference
entry.summary:
Author: murphy_stoffelis

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,939Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 188

Summary: A violent blight is sweeping through Gotham. Innocent people are suddenly being consumed by rage with disastrous consequences. With no cure in sight, Jason finds himself working with Batman to save the city from madness. Even with his resurrection a thing of the past, an alliance with the Bats is a harrowing line between reconnecting with a former life and preserving the Red Hood's hard-won autonomy— especially when Jason's partnership with Dick Grayson begins to rekindle a past they've both tried to bury. Because in a city like Gotham, you can't trust who you love. Not even family.

entry.title: to stand on the very stones
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,008Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 17

Summary: There were moments, before Code Black had been fully initiated, when Dick would spot Jason across the rooftops and do nothing but yearn to be closer, despite the wide rift between them. He yearned to feel the pads of his gloves press against the curve of Jason’s back, to wrap his arms around Jason’s body and pull them both closer together. He had found himself spending more and more time envisioning the way Jason’s hands would feel roaming his body, what sounds Jason made when he was aroused, the way Jason kissed, who had he kissed, how often, were they any better at it than Dick was? He imagined proving to Jason that he was the best option for him and that Jason would accept it, as if no other person existed beyond the two of them for each other.

entry.title: Between Masks
entry.summary:
Author: AceofWeb

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,863Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 15

Summary: Written by the request of Cheerfully_Melancholly , this chapter follows Dick as he finally finds a moment alone in Wayne Manor, free from missions and expectations. What begins as a simple act of self-indulgence turns into something far more intimate, a quiet rebellion against the constant performance of being perfect. Alone, he confronts his reflection, his desires, and the body that has never fully felt like his own. For a brief, stolen moment, he allows himself to feel whole, to imagine being truly seen. But just as he begins to surrender to that fragile illusion, the sound of a doorknob turning reminds him that even in solitude, he is never truly free

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 176,610Chapters: 37/53Kudos: 1,365

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: Nightwing & Red Hood: Snow Birds
entry.summary:
Author: Robin Spotter (robinspotter)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 135,005Chapters: 28/?Kudos: 210

Summary: ***Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings under an abundance of caution. You have been warned that everything or nothing at all that personally squicks or offends you may be in this fic!*** At the end of the Joker War, Dick Grayson regained a lifetime of memories, but the mind is a twisty place. How can he reconcile a lifetime's worth of traumas when the memories have returned in agonizing detail as if they happened yesterday? How can he go forward when he remembers everything that he had ever let himself forget?Jason Todd was a teenager when his life was stolen from him in explosive violence. He has walked a long, lonely, and bitter path home to Gotham. With a new resolve not to kill, he still hangs on the fringes of tenuous ties with the Batman family. Until Dick's spiraling descent crashes into him full throttle, forcing him to confront long denied feelings.When circumstance leads them into a marriage of convenience, will they be able to overcome together what neither could overcome alone?
